verbs.description: injoin (third-person singular simple present injoins, present participle injoining, simple past and past participle injoined)

examples: When theſe Favours were beſtowed, the Sentences were read over, by which Penances were injoined the Criminals.
The firſt Sentences were those of the Croſs-Bearers, who were injoined to wear Croſſes on their Breaſt and Back, and if their Crimes were very heinous, they were condemned to wear two.
